title: Barack Obama Relieved He Never Had Son
description:
Barack Obamaopened up about fatherhood and personal shortcomings during a revealing conversation onMichelle Obamaâ€˜s podcast, admitting heâ€™s thankful he didnâ€™t have to raise a son because he believes it would have been â€œmore difficult.â€

The former president, now 63, joined his wife on her show,Michelle Obama: The Light Podcast, where he reflected on parenting their daughters,Malia, 27, andSasha, 24, and why heâ€™s relieved they never had a son.
â€œI think we did a pretty good job of raising our girls, but Iâ€™ve said often that I think I would have had more difficulty raising a son,â€Barack Obamasaid. Michelle, 61, didnâ€™t hesitate to back him up, replying, â€œI agree.â€
Obama explained that his concern wasnâ€™t about discipline or expectationsâ€”it was empathy. â€œI think I mightâ€™ve been more judgmental, harder,â€ he admitted.
He also pointed to his own upbringing, which lacked a consistent male role model.
â€œI wouldâ€™ve tried toâ€”Iâ€™d like to think I would have been more self-aware enough to combat that,â€ he said. â€œBut I just think father-son relationships, for me, particularly if I donâ€™t have a dad around to show it to me, mightâ€™ve been more difficult.â€
Obamaâ€™s father, Barack Obama Sr., was largely absent from his life.
In a 2021 Instagram post, the former president wrote, â€œI didnâ€™t really know my fatherâ€”he left my mother and me when I was two years old, and only traveled from Kenya to visit us once, when I was ten. That trip was the first and last I saw of him; after that, I heard from him only through the occasional letter.â€
The episode adds another layer to Obamaâ€™s long-standing reflections on fatherhood, identity and the emotional gaps left by his fatherâ€™s absence. The podcast was released in 2024.

title: Project Patâ€™s Sonâ€™s Accused Killer Arrested After Struggle With U.S. Marshals
description:
A woman named Talia Jones was taken into custody Tuesday (July 15) in Minneapolis by U.S. Marshals after being charged in connection with theJanuary shooting death of Patrick Houston Jr.,the son of Memphis rap veteran and brother of Juicy J, Project Pat.

Jones, who had been wanted for facilitation of first-degree murder, allegedly resisted arrest when authorities located her. â€œShe did not go quietly,â€ the U.S. Marshals Service said in a statement. Officials said she physically fought back and tried to avoid being detained.
The Memphis Police Department issued a warrant for Jonesâ€™ arrest on June 27, nearly six months after Houston Jr. was gunned down in broad daylight at the intersection of Ketchum Road and Long Street near Charjean Park in the Imogene Heights neighborhood. Officers arrived at the scene around 1:15 p.m. on January 10 and found Houston Jr. dead from a gunshot wound, according to a post on Twitter (X) from the department.
No further details about the motive or circumstances surrounding the shooting have been released.
Houston Jr.â€™s obituary confirmed he was 22 years old. A memorial service was held January 25 at M.J. Edwards Funeral Home in Memphis, with burial following at Memphis Memory Gardens.
Project Pat, born Patrick Earl Houston, is known for his work with Three 6 Mafia and his solo career, which took off after his 1999 debut album,Ghetty Green. He gained national attention with the 2000 hit â€œSippinâ€™ On Some Syrupâ€ and has since collaborated with artists like Drake, Rick Ross and Denzel Curry.
Following his sonâ€™s death, Project Pat posted on Instagram, â€œBoy i thank God for another day. @breakinbaggs @gofoundation9 #letsgo.â€ DJ Paul, a founding member of Three 6 Mafia, responded with a string of prayer emojis.
Project Pat now focuses much of his time on prison ministry and runs the Go Foundation, a nonprofit aimed at outreach and rehabilitation for incarcerated individuals.
Jones remains in custody following her arrest in Minnesota.

title: Eminemâ€™s â€œSTANSâ€ Documentary Hits Theaters Worldwide For One Weekend Only
description:
Eminem is bringing his most devoted followers to the big screen withSTANS, a new documentary hitting theaters worldwide for a limited run from Thursday to Sunday (August 7â€“10, 2025), spotlighting the intense loyalty and emotional connection thatâ€™s defined his fanbase for nearly three decades.

More than 135 AMC locations across the U.S. and over 1,600 theaters in more than 50 countries will screen the film, which dives deep into the culture of â€œsuperfandomâ€ through the lens ofEminemâ€™smost passionate supportersâ€”known globally as â€œstans.â€
Directed by Steven Leckart and produced by Eminem himself,STANSblends rare archival footage, stylized reenactments, and personal stories from real-life fans whose lives have been shaped by the Detroit rapperâ€™s music.
The film also includes a new interview with Eminem, where he reflects on his legacy and the people whoâ€™ve followed him from the beginning.
A post shared by Marshall Mathers (@eminem)
The title draws from Eminemâ€™s 2000 track â€œStan,â€ a song that not only introduced the term into pop culture but also helped define a generation of obsessive music loyalty.
The word â€œstanâ€ was officially added to the Oxford English Dictionary in 2017 and Merriam-Webster in 2019.
STANSmade its debut at the first-ever SXSW London festival, earning early praise from critics. Ahead of its global release, the documentary will also have a weeklong awards-qualifying run at AMC Empire 25 in New York.
Tickets for U.S. screenings are available now through AMC, while international ticket sales begin Thursday (July 23). The film will eventually be available to stream on Paramount+.
A companion soundtrack featuring unreleased music from Eminem is also available for pre-order, timed to coincide with the filmâ€™s theatrical release.
A post shared by Marshall Mathers (@eminem)

title: EXCLUSIVE: Damon Dash Ordered To Court By Judge To Explain Himself Or Face Arrest â€“ Hereâ€™s How He Can Get Out Of It
description:
Damon Dashhas been summoned to federal court in Manhattan after failing to turn over key ownership documents tied to a $4 million judgment.

The judge has grown impatient and warned Dash that he could be arrested if he doesnâ€™t comply by the end of the month.
U.S. Magistrate Judge Robert W. Lehrburger issued the order after Dash and his company,Poppington LLC, missed a July 10 deadline to submit certificates proving their ownership in several businesses and copyrights.
The paperwork was required so the U.S. Marshal could sell the assets at a public auction to help satisfy the judgment. As of July 14, the court confirmed that Dash and Poppington had not complied with the order.
Lehrburger noted this was part of a â€œpattern of non-compliance and delayâ€ and scheduled a hearing for July 31 at 10 A.M., where Dash must personally explain why he should not face sanctions.
If Dash fails to appear, the court may issue a warrant for his arrest and impose financial penalties. However, he can avoid the hearing altogether by submitting the required documents by July 30.
The legal battle stems from a years-long dispute with filmmaker Josh Webber over the 2019 filmâ€œDear Frank.â€
Dash was removed from the project but later claimed ownership, prompting Webber and Muddy Water Pictures to sue for defamation and copyright infringement.
In 2022, a judge ordered Dash to pay $805,000 for failing to comply with court deadlines and refusing to participate in mediation.
The situation escalated after Dash made defamatory remarks about Webber on theEarn Your Leisurepodcast. This resulted in a $4 million default judgment in 2025.
To recover the damages, the court approved the sale of Dashâ€™s interests in several companies, including Dash Films Inc., Bluroc LLC, Blakroc LLC, Lebanon Improvements LLC, Ocean East Improvements LLC and 1996 Songs LLC. Poppington LLC was also ordered to hand over copyright certificates for multiple films.
Webberâ€™s legal team confirmed Dashâ€™s attorneys had not delivered the documents.
Earlier this week,they sent a letter to the court, requesting an arrest warrant and asking that the disputed assets be transferred to the U.S. Marshal for auction.
Dash previously sold his one-third share of Roc-A-Fella Records for a little over $1 million in December 2024, but the proceeds didnâ€™t cover the full judgment due to outstanding obligations to the state of New York, which purchased the asset.
The court is now trying to enforce the remaining balance through asset liquidation.
The auction will be conducted by the U.S. Marshal, with any leftover funds returned to Dash after the judgment is satisfied.

title: BeyoncÃ© Concert Ends In Chaos As Escalator Stampede Injures Nine In Atlanta
description:
BeyoncÃ©concertgoers were caught in a chaotic stampede at Atlantaâ€™s Vine City MARTA station on Monday night (July 14) after a womanâ€™s scream over an insect triggered panic, sending people scrambling for safety and leaving nine injured.

The incident unfolded just after the final show of BeyoncÃ©â€™s Cowboy Carter Tour at Mercedes-Benz Stadium, when a woman reportedly spotted a bug, screamed and bolted.
Her reaction set off a chain of confusion in the packed station, with others running in fear, unsure of what caused the commotion.
â€œThe initial reports were that a woman was scared of an insect and screamed and ran away from it, and others panicked not knowing what was happening,â€ a MARTAspokespersonexplained.
As the crowd surged toward the escalators, the moving staircase suddenly accelerated, then came to a jarring stop. Riders lost their balance and tumbled, piling onto one another in a heap of sequins, boots and panic.
Nine people were hurt in the melee. One person suffered a broken ankle, seven others were treated at hospitals for scrapes and bruises, and one declined medical attention.
Footage from the scene showed several concertgoersâ€”many still dressed in Cowboy Carter-inspired outfitsâ€”being wheeled away on stretchers and in wheelchairs.
The stampede capped off a turbulent week forBeyoncÃ©in Atlanta. Just days earlier, on Tuesday (July 8), her team suffered a major security breach when thieves broke into a rental vehicle andstoleunreleased music and confidential tour materials.
Among the items taken were laptops, designer clothing, Apple AirPods Max headphones and, most critically, five thumb drives and hard drives containing unreleased BeyoncÃ© tracks, show footage and both past and future set lists.
Investigators tracked the stolen electronics using built-in location services and reviewed surveillance footage from the garage.
They recovered partial fingerprints and identified a possible suspect vehicleâ€”a red 2025 Hyundai Elantra. By Tuesday (July 15), an arrest warrant had been issued, though no arrest had been made and the stolen materials remained missing.

title: T.D. Jakes Claims 44,000 AI Bots Spread Diddy Lies In Digital Smear Campaign
description:
T.D. Jakes said he was bombarded by 44,000 AI-generated bots that flooded the internet with false claims tying him toSean â€œDiddyâ€ Combsand alleged sex parties, calling it a coordinated smear campaign targeting prominent Black public figures.

Themegachurch leaderand media mogul addressed the digital onslaught during a recent interview, revealing the scale of the misinformation push. â€œWhen the [rumors] first broke out, it was 44,000 bots that were released on me,â€ Jakes said. He added that an investigation â€œdiscovered that 98% of them were all artificial intelligence-generated.â€
The rumors, which gained traction online in the wake of multiple lawsuits and criminal allegations against Diddy in 2024 and 2025, falsely linked Jakes to criminal behavior and salacious events.
He was named in a lawsuit as someone Diddy allegedly tried to use for image control, but Jakes was never accused of any wrongdoing.
Fake videos and AI-manipulated thumbnails circulated on YouTube, falsely depicting Jakes being arrested or attending parties connected to Diddy. None of the content was supported by credible evidence.
Jakes and his legal team have sincefiled motionsseeking information from YouTube and Google to uncover who is behind the false content. The goal is to identify the individuals or groups responsible for launching the bot-driven attacks.
Jakes made it clear he had no involvement in any of the alleged incidents. â€œThe other thing that it really proved to me, to Oprah, to Denzel, to all the people, is that itâ€™s everybody. It goes along with the turf,â€ he said. â€œWe have got to stop getting our information from TikTok,â€ he said.
A post shared by HOLLYWOOD UNLOCKED (@hollywoodunlocked)
He also dismissed the rumors as baseless. â€œThatâ€™s kinda water under the bridge. If there were anything there, the FBI would have been in it â€¦ Itâ€™s like when I had my health scareâ€”within seconds, it was all over the world, you wouldnâ€™t have to find it on Instagram, you wouldnâ€™t have to find it on YouTube. You would find it on the 6 oâ€™clock news.â€
Jakes suffered a heart attack in November 2024 while preaching at The Potterâ€™s House in Dallas.
After recovering, he stepped down as senior pastor. Jakes then handed over leadership to his daughter, Sarah Jakes Roberts and her husband, TourÃ© Roberts.
author: London Jennn

title: Kendrick Lamar Scores Four Emmy Nods After Dismantling Drake
description:
Kendrick Lamarearned four Emmy nominations Tuesday (July 15) for his Apple Music Super Bowl LIX Halftime Show, placing him in the running for Variety Special, Directing, Music Direction and Choreography. The high-profile performance, broadcast by Fox, marked another milestone in the Pulitzer Prize winnerâ€™s career as he continues to blend commercial success with critical acclaim.

Lamarâ€™s halftime set was praised for its sharp visuals and tight execution, adding another layer to his already decorated resume. The Emmy recognition arrives as Lamar remains a central figure in rapâ€™s most talked-about feud of the year.
His lyrical war with Drake has dominated headlines since last spring, with both artists trading pointed diss tracks. Lamarâ€™s â€œNot Like Usâ€ became a cultural moment, with its beat and bars dissected across social media and radio.
The track, widely seen as a direct hit at Drake, fueled a wave of response tracks and commentary. The back-and-forth has reignited interest in lyrical competition in Hip-Hop, drawing comparisons to past rivalries. It also sparked Drakeâ€™s lawsuit with his label, Universal Music Group, which he accused of defamation and negligence over the release and aggressive promotion of â€œNot Like Us.â€
The lawsuit, submitted in January 2025, alleges that Universalâ€™s promotion of the songâ€”which features lyrics insinuating Drake is a pedophileâ€”directly endangered his life and career by fueling public hostility and multiple security threats, including a shooting at his Toronto residence and the circulation of flyers labeling him a predator. The complaint also claims the trackâ€™s cover art displayed an aerial photo of Drakeâ€™s home, further encouraging harassment and potentially inciting vigilante behavior.
Drakeâ€™s legal team asserts that Universal Music Group leaned into the songâ€™s commercial potential at his expense, leveraging its viral success and cultural impactâ€”bolstered by high-profile Grammy and Super Bowl promotionsâ€”to gain negotiating power ahead of contract renewals with both he and Lamar.
Despite â€œNot Like Usâ€ becoming a chart-topping hit and cultural milestone, Drakeâ€™s lawsuit pointedly targets Universal, not Kendrick Lamar himself, for allegedly prioritizing profit over artist safety and disseminating â€œfalse and maliciousâ€ narratives. Universal has moved to dismiss the lawsuit, arguing that Drakeâ€™s claims are merely an attempt to recover from what they describe as a self-provoked and publicly lost rap battle, while Drakeâ€™s counsel maintains that the label is responsible for amplifying dangerous misinformation that has already led to real-world consequences
While the Emmy nominations celebrate Lamarâ€™s artistic achievements on stage, the ongoing tension with Drake keeps his name circulating far beyond award season chatter.
BeyoncÃ© also landed four nods for her Netflix special,BeyoncÃ© Bowl, which showcased her 2023 Renaissance World Tour performance. The production is up for Variety Special, Directing, Production Design and Choreography. Both specials are now in the Emmy race alongside the 67th Annual Grammy Awards, which scored nominations for Production Design, Lighting Design/Direction, Sound Mixing and Choreography.
Winners will be announced during the 76th Primetime Emmy Awards on September 14.
author: AllHipHop Staff

title: Justin Bieberâ€™s Shot At Clipse Gives Hip-Hop Pause At Pop Star

TheCanadianpop star surprised fans withSWAG, his first album in four years, while Virginia duo Clipse made a thunderous return withLet God Sort Em Out. Despite a divided fanbase and little direct competition, the matchup got testy after the numbers came in, and Clipse took the top position. Now, this may not be reflected in the charts of mainstream, but for usâ€¦Clipse are No. 1. and Bieber knows it.
Rather than offer congratulations or stay quiet, Bieber decided to post an Instagram Story that took direct aim atPusha TandMalice. Some joker named Kerwin Frost mocked Clipseâ€™s fanbase as â€œbitter grown men who collect Kaws dolls and shop at Kith and Union.â€ At first, I thought that was Beebz. But, Bieber opted to repost and add, â€œThis is the only album that matters right now,â€ in all caps. OH.
The post didnâ€™t last long. Bieber deleted it swiftly. But we are going to immortalize it. The move came off salty, in my opinion.SWAGmarked his first release in years and was generally well received. He leaned on rap heavy to make that happen. But taking a jab at Clipse? Bad look.
Bieber is still signed to Def Jam, the same label Clipse left behind. Some folks have suggested the label pushed him to pull the diss, fearing a mess from the brothers. Considering Pusha Tâ€™s track record surgical takedowns, he doesnâ€™t want to be the next Canadian on the menu. We remember the Drake situation. Rap has always shown this guy love (just ask Diddy).
Clipse, to their credit, didnâ€™t even respond. They let the people and charts speak for them.Let God Sort Em Outis the No. 1 most talked about album right now. They have the critical acclaim and high-art features.
Bieber has to put his feelings in check. Some have accused him of using drugs. I hope not, but maybe thatâ€™s where he and Clipse can have common ground. A fiend and some coke rappers. That may be too far. Anyway, glad both albums are getting good reviews and praise. By the way, Bieber is 31.
Maybe he should call him â€œJustin Beefer.â€

title: SIGNS: Black Cyclist Arrested For Shooting His White Attackerâ€”Despite â€œStand Your Groundâ€ Law
description:
Reginald Butler was arrested and charged with aggravated assault in Adams County, Mississippi after a white man who allegedly attacked him earlier that day was shot during a second confrontation on a rural bridge, according toreports.

Deputies responded Friday evening (July 11) to reports of a fight near a party on Deerfield Road, but before they arrived, they were informed that a shooting had occurred. Investigators later determined that two separate encounters led to the gunfire.
In the first incident, captured partially on video, Butler was seen being beaten by a group of white men. He escaped the attack on a bicycle. About a mile away, one of those men allegedly confronted Butler again on a bridge, exited a vehicle and began assaulting him, witnesses said.
Butler then pulled a firearm and fired multiple rounds, striking the man in the chest and hitting the vehicle once. Both men fled the scene.
Butler was later located at his home and taken into custody. The firearm believed to have been used in the shooting was recovered. The wounded man was transported by emergency crews to Kingston Ball Field, where he was airlifted to a hospital.
Butler was also taken to a hospital by deputies to be treated for injuries from the earlier assault.
Authorities identified Cameron Taunton as one of the men involved in the initial beating. He was initially charged with simple assault causing bodily injury. Despite video evidence and witness statements indicating Butler was attacked a second time before he fired his weapon, he remains in custody at the Adams County Jail.
Adams County Sheriff Travis Patten addressed the communityâ€™s growing concerns after the video of the initial assault surfaced.
â€œTo the individuals whose identities were captured in these videos or whose voices can be heard on the videos, come to the sheriffâ€™s office on Monday first thing, or we will be seeking you out and picking you up,â€ Patten said. â€œWe are deeply troubled by the recent incident involving the assault on Reginald Butler and the subsequent arrest of all parties involved.
â€œThe emergence of videos has shed new light on the events that took place that day when three individuals unjustly attacked a man who was simply minding his own business. We recognize the profound pain, anger and frustration this has caused the entire community and we share in the outrage over this injustice. Hate has no place in our society and certainly not in our community that has made so much progress.â€
Still, Patten offered a rationale for Butlerâ€™s arrest that some have questioned.
â€œThe decision to charge Butler with aggravated assault reflects the totality of circumstances at this stage,â€ Patten said, â€œincluding whether the use of force met legal standards for self-defense under Mississippi law. All of this is being reviewed now that the video evidence has emerged and statements have changed.â€
Patten also noted that Butler had attempted to return to the scene of the initial assault, which he initially said factored into the decision to charge himâ€”a claim he later admitted â€œisnâ€™t completely accurate.â€
Mississippi is one of 38 states with a â€œStand Your Groundâ€ law, which allows individuals to use deadly force if they reasonably believe it is necessary to prevent death or great bodily harm. Critics have long argued these laws are not applied equally, particularly when Black individuals claim self-defense.
Butler was released on a $50,000 bond on Monday (July 13). Tauntonâ€™s charges have been upgraded to aggravated assault and conspiracy to commit aggravated assault. Heâ€™s being held on a $350,000 bond.
author: AllHipHop Staff

title: Bhad Bhabie Explodes Over Alleged Lawsuit Leak By Her Mother
description:

She also said she was never served with any legal documents and insisted there was no active case.

She ended the post by telling her mother to move on. â€œPlease STay out of my life Barbara,â€ she wrote.
This isnâ€™t the first time Bhad Bhabie has gone public with accusations against her mother.

title: Gervonta â€˜Tankâ€™ Davis Allegedly Beat Baby Moms 10 Times, Facing Possible Jail Time
description:
Gervonta â€œTankâ€ Davis is undefeated in a boxing ring. However, outside the ring, the hooks are busting him up.  Legally and morally, we have an issue.ESPNis reporting that Davis, 30, may have assaulted the mother of his childrenat least10 times over the course of their relationship.  The allegations are disturbing and seem to be repetitive.

This is a pattern.
The latest incident, which occurred onFatherâ€™s Dayin Doral, Florida, has rumors coming out of the new battery charges. Police allege Davis hit his ex-girlfriend in the back of the head and slapped her outside of her home. Thatâ€™s the official report. But whatâ€™s not in the docket is the history. That is a bit â€œyetâ€ as well. Sources cited by ESPN say this woman has been on the receiving end of Davisâ€™ fistsmultipletimes over the years. I happen to believe authorities and his childrenâ€™s mother might be done giving him passes.
He is out now, but for how long?
Right now, these are misdemeanor charges. But the sheer volume of alleged abuse could push prosecutors to elevate this into a felony case. If she â€œflipsâ€ or if theyâ€™re pressured to treat Davis like a civilian and not a cash cow. Stars are treated different in the justice system. I donâ€™t want this, but Davis could face real prison time. I hope he gets help! What could be driving him to risk it all like this?
His career could also suffer a critical hit.Davis has a fight coming up. And that fight he nearly lost! He got dropped even though they did not count it as such. Taking a kneeâ€¦is a knock down. That may be one of the reasons the alleged victim hasnâ€™t pursued heavier charges in the past. We know that â€œdo not mess up the moneyâ€ mantra well!
Davis has faced trouble before. In 2022, he was arrested for allegedly slapping a woman during a separate domestic incident. Those charges were dropped. How many more before someone steps in? Where is Don King when you need him?
Focus, Tank!

title: Cardi B Fires Back At BBL Smell Rumors In No-Filter Rant
description:
Cardi Bshut down viral gossip about her body in a no-holds-barred Twitter Spaces rant Friday (July 11) after rumors swirled that her Brazilian Butt Lift (BBL) had a foul odor and allegedly drove a wedge between her and boyfriendStefon Diggs.

â€œFirst of all, I donâ€™t know who made that up,â€ Cardi said during the X (Twitter) Spaces chat. â€œBut b####, thatâ€™s you â€¦ Thatâ€™s on you, b####. That could never be me.â€
The speculation kicked off earlier the week after Cardi wiped Diggs from her Instagram, prompting online chatter that the NFL star dumped her over what some posts called a â€œBBL smell.â€
Some of the more viral claims quoted Diggs as saying her body â€œsmelled like a trash bagâ€ or â€œgarbage truck juice.â€ Diggs, however, publicly denied ever saying anything of the sort, calling the rumors â€œcap.â€
Cardi didnâ€™t hold back as she addressed the claims head-on, reminding listeners of her past and her hygiene standards.
â€œB####, I was a f###### stripper; you had to smell good all the time,â€ she said. â€œI was raised by women, like please.â€
A post shared by AllHipHop (@allhiphopcom)
The Bronx-born rapper is also in the middle of a major rollout for her long-awaited sophomore album,Am I the Drama?which drops September 19 via Atlantic Records.
The project marks her first full-length release since 2018â€™s Grammy-winningInvasion of Privacy.
The campaign kicked off June 22 with a teaser video showing Cardi in a black gown surrounded by crows. The next day, she revealed the albumâ€™s cover art and release date with a theatrical voiceover.
A post shared by Cardi B (@iamcardib)
Am I the Drama?will include 23 tracks, including previously released hits â€œWAPâ€ with Megan Thee Stallion, â€œUpâ€ and the new single â€œOutside.â€
The album arrives Friday (September 19).

title: Kanye West Misses Pusha T, Pusha T Doesnâ€™t Care
description:
PushaT & Kanye West: Loyalty Lost and Trumpets Blown in New CLIPSE Era

Pusha T and Kanye West are two names that once moved in perfect synchronicity, at least thatâ€™s how it seemed. Now, theyâ€™re now moving in totally opposite directions.Let God Sort Em Outis here! King Push is using the rollout to clear the air and set people straight. People is Kanye West.
In a recent sit-down withComplex, Pusha didnâ€™t dodge the elephant in the room. When asked about Kanye West missing their bond, Push came back with a cold response.

Iâ€™m not in a position to where I can even risk and gamble with the wishy-washiness or the lack of loyalty. I donâ€™t play like that. Why would I ever dive back into that type of scenario? Iâ€™m with my brother and Pharrell, come on. I donâ€™t even understand that lack of principles just amongst people you call your brother. I donâ€™t get that. Thatâ€™s not for me.â€

title: Consequence & Caiden Talk Upcoming Kanye West-Produced Single, Going Viral & More
description:
Consequenceand his 13-year-old son,Caiden The Crownholder,Â are real legacy vibes. The father-son duo caught up withAllHipHopand brought charisma and generational energy. Caiden, who recently went viral with more than five million views on hisOn The Radarfreestyle, is emerging as a force in his own right.

Meanwhile, Consequence is set to release a new single produced by longtime collaboratorÂ Kanye West. The two spoke candidly withAllHipHopabout the state of Hip-Hop, creating music in the TikTok era, their upcoming projects and more. Cons admitted that his son tends to raid the closet, but he had his own as well.
AllHipHop (Chuck Creekmur):AllHipHop is in the building once again with Consequence and Caiden the Crownholder. You still holding that crown?
Caiden: No doubt. Absolutely.
AllHipHop: Since the last time we talked, you had one of theTop 10 Most Viral On the Radarfreestyles on TikTok.
Caiden The Crownholder:Yeah, itâ€™s at 5.4 million now.
AllHipHop: Thatâ€™s whatâ€™s up! Hey, man, I gotta ask you this, how does it feel to have a dad that loves you so openly and publicly? Itâ€™s documented.
Caiden: Itâ€™s the greatest feeling in the world.
AllHipHop:Thatâ€™s whatâ€™s up. And, Cons, your son issotalented. You gotta be proud.
Consequence: Absolutely. This has been the happiest Fatherâ€™s Day Iâ€™ve had. His album is done. We outside this summer.
AllHipHop: When yâ€™all pulling up to the studio for a full interview?
Consequence: July.
AllHipHop: Bet. Weâ€™re locked in. Letâ€™s talk music. Caiden, youâ€™re in the game now and itâ€™s a tough space. How are you feeling about the landscape?
Caiden: I feel pretty good. New things are coming to me. Iâ€™m rocking with it. Itâ€™s been good lately.
AllHipHop:Cons, what about you?
Consequence: You know me. Itâ€™s wash, rinse, repeat. These days itâ€™s about being a content creator. TikTok, Instagramâ€”you gotta adjust. Back in the day, you had to learn how to scratch, how to use MySpace. Itâ€™s always evolving.
AllHipHop: So whatâ€™s changed?
Consequence: Itâ€™s just a new format, but Hip-Hopâ€™s always been about pushing forward. From â€œCallinâ€™ Meâ€to newer music, weâ€™ve taken this thing further than we ever imagined. Like a wise man once said: â€œWe never thought weâ€™d take it this far.â€ So wehave tokeep going. The road may get rocky, but we know the texture, the sound, the feel. Itâ€™s our responsibility to pass that knowledge on to the next generation, like this guy right here. Thatâ€™s how the tradition stays alive.
AllHipHop: Respect. It doesnâ€™t always feel like itâ€™s ours anymore.
Consequence: Nah, Iâ€™m not having that. Never have. Iâ€™ve never been the type to kick my feet up. Itâ€™s boots to the ground with me, always.
AllHipHop: Letâ€™s talk about the music yâ€™all are creating. What should we expect from the project? Any features?
Consequence: Absolutely. Weâ€™ll be dropping the tracklist soon. Heâ€™s 13 and already has incredible records. The charisma, the MCing, the versatilityâ€”itâ€™s all there. And yes, we kept some traditional vibes too. Iâ€™ll say thisâ€”we have a record with me, Caiden, Cory Gunz andPeter Gunz.
AllHipHop:Thatâ€™s aÂ classicÂ lineup.
Consequence: You already know.Cory Gunzcanspit. Iâ€™m a rapperâ€™s rapperâ€”but also a songwriter, and Iâ€™m always about that check. Thatâ€™s well documented. But the bars? Theyâ€™re still there. Just wait until you hear it.
AllHipHop: Iâ€™m familiar. Iâ€™m looking forward to that one.
Consequence: Letâ€™s go!
AllHipHop: OK, switching gearsâ€”I hate to do this, but I gotta ask: Whatâ€™s up with your boy?
Consequence: Which one?
AllHipHop: Letâ€™s start with Kanye. Whatâ€™s the word?
Consequence: Letâ€™s save that for the longer sit-down. But when my new single dropsâ€”and yes, Ye produced itâ€”weâ€™ll talk. Iâ€™ve got the beat of the summeragain. I wasnâ€™t lying last time, and Iâ€™m not lying now. This joint is incredible.
AllHipHop: Say less. Looking forward to it. On the fashion tip, thoughâ€”you see the drip, the kicks. You stay fresh.
Consequence: You know how I do.
AllHipHop: Caiden, whatâ€™s your favorite fashion item right now?
Caiden: Probably myHublotwatchâ€”and of course, the chain.
AllHipHop: Hublot! Excuse me, young king! Cons, I see the family doing well!
Consequence: Weâ€™re in a great space. Since the last time you saw him, heâ€™s grown up. Now weâ€™re at a point where we wear the same sneakers. Iâ€™ve been looking forward to that. Itâ€™s a whole new vibe nowâ€”double the flavor.
AllHipHop: Yâ€™all wearing the same size?
Consequence: Same sneakers, not the clothes yet. But we getting there.
AllHipHop: That reminds me of my pops. Youâ€™ve created something special.
Consequence: Appreciate that. This is a special moment in time for us. And I canâ€™t wait for people to hear his new album.
AllHipHop: Spicy?
Consequence: Spicy. And heâ€™s talkinghoton there, too.

title: â€œSquid Gameâ€ Actors Park Sung-hoon & Kang Ae-sim Talk Season 3 & Hip-Hopâ€™s Influence
description:
Squid Gameis here and AllHipHopâ€™sD-Nellzcaught up with two of the showâ€™s breakout starsâ€”Park Sung-hoon(Player 120) andKang Ae-sim(Player 149). This exclusive conversation touched on acting, strategy and the cultural impact of Hip-Hop in Korea. The wildly popular Netflix series continues to push boundaries and these two Korean actors bring both emotional depth and cultural insight.

Park Sung-hoon shares how Hip-Hop influenced his personal style growing up and how it still motivates him on set. He recalls bumping tracks by Korean rap legends likeYDG(Yang Dong-geun, Squid Games Season 2)andTANOSduring hisSquid Gameshoot days. Kang Ae-sim, a veteran of Korean theater and screen, offers her thoughtful take on the showâ€™s evolution and the surreal experience of joining the internationally beloved Netflix show.
The duo even discusses whether theyâ€™d survive in the real Squid Game and who was the class clown on set.
AllHipHop (D-Nellz): Hip-Hop has become huge across Asia. How has it impacted you personally or creatively?
Park Sung-hoon:A few years ago, Hip-Hop exploded in Koreaâ€”thanks in part to shows likeShow Me The Money. That show gave Hip-Hop a serious spotlight. And itâ€™s wildâ€”two of ourSquid Gamecastmates, TANOS and Yong-sik, are legit Hip-Hop figures. Growing up, I was heavily influenced by Hip-Hopâ€”if you look at old photos of me, Iâ€™m rocking oversized gear, big pendants, towels around my neckâ€”just fully in that world. Iâ€™ve also worked with a lot of actors who started out as musicians, so I listen to their music while filming. I used to play a lot of YDG and TANOS on my way to set.
AllHipHop: Kang Ae-sim, do you feel a connection between musicâ€”Hip-Hop or otherwiseâ€”and acting?
Kang Ae-sim:Absolutely. Music helps unlock emotional energy, and it influences the rhythm of how I approach a role. Even if Iâ€™m not immersed in Hip-Hop like Park is, I respect the genre deeply.
AllHipHop: When you first read the script for Season 3, what was your reaction?
Park Sung-hoon:Honestly? I was shocked. I didnâ€™t expect a third season, but the script was incredibly tight. It felt like Seasons 2 and 3 were always meant to follow the original. It was that well put together.
Kang Ae-sim:I felt the same way. Season 1 was meant to be the end, but it got so much love, the world expanded. The writing surprised meâ€”it was complex, emotional, and thrilling.
AllHipHop: Did you feel any pressure knowing the entire world was watching?
Park Sung-hoon:Not pressureâ€”more like disbelief. It was surreal to realize I was part of something this big. I just focused on doing my best and enjoying the process.
AllHipHop: If you were in the real Squid Game, would you go solo or build an alliance?
Park Sung-hoon:[Laughs] One, two, threeâ€”build an alliance. I definitely want help. This isnâ€™t a game you want to go through alone!
AllHipHop: Last questionâ€”whoâ€™s more serious on set, and whoâ€™s more playful?
Park Sung-hoon:[Laughs] Iâ€™ll admit itâ€”Iâ€™m the playful one. I love keeping the mood light between scenes.
Kang Ae-sim:And Iâ€™m probably the more serious one. But we balance each other out well.

title: Hip-Hop Gamerâ€™s Vision: From Denzel Washingtonâ€™s School To Samsung Studios To Bars With Papoose
description:
Hip-Hop, Health and High Scores: AllHipHop Catches Up with Hip-Hop Gamer

Hip-Hop Gamer,neeGerard Williams,  is no ordinary content creator. The Brooklyn native  a walking ball of energy. He a tech-savvy visionary cultural connector whoâ€™s changing the game, literally.
From rocking a championship belt at gaming conventions to spitting bars Papoose and Smoke DZA, the he has carved a lane all his own. Known for fusing Hip-Hop, video games, tech, and wellness, Hip-Hop Gamer is on a mission. He wants to uplift the next generation through innovation and inspiration.
Heâ€™s partnered with Chase Bank to pay students $100 an hour to game and collaborated with the goat Denzel Washington. HHGâ€™s impact is undeniable. AllHipHopâ€™sChuck â€œJigsawâ€ Creekmurcaught up with the new media powerhouse to talk about the future of gaming, the power of healthy living and his latest music moves. All gas. Letâ€™s get it.
AllHipHop:First off, salute to the energy you bring every time. Youâ€™re like a battery pack for the culture. Whatâ€™s new with you right now?
Hip-Hop Gamer:Man, I appreciate that! Big love toDenzel Washington. He let me bring my gaming program to his school. But now, Iâ€™m doing something even crazier: my first-everChase Bank Get Money Gamerstour. Kids are getting paid $100 an hour to play video games and write reports. Itâ€™s becoming a movement in education.
AllHipHop:$100 an hour?! Thatâ€™s wild. And youâ€™re talking about making this standard in schools?
Hip-Hop Gamer:Facts! Itâ€™s about showing how gaming can be productive, educational and profitable. This ainâ€™t just for fun. This is real career prep. Weâ€™re out here creating systems for success through gaming.
AllHipHop:Letâ€™s switch gears, all pun intended. Whatâ€™s hot in gaming right now?
Hip-Hop Gamer:Yo,Resident Evil 9is bananas. They got Shinobi-style movement in there â€“ insane.Nintendo Switch 2just dropped too, withMario Kart World.Itâ€™s a whole new vibe. Gotta cop that, especially to bond with the fam. But warning: if you lose in Mario Kart? Itâ€™s war! StraightSpades-in-a-Black-householdenergy.
AllHipHop:[Laughs] Yeah, my nephews already cooked me and clowned me heavy.
Hip-Hop Gamer:Aye! Trash talk is earned. But let them know, keep those grades up. If you canâ€™t back that trash talk with results in school, gaming privileges might vanish. Accountability still matters.
AllHipHop:We know you also spit. Whatâ€™s the latest on the rap side?
Hip-Hop Gamer:Oh, itâ€™s going crazy. Iâ€™m on the intro for theStreet Fighter 6Hip-Hop album. Shout out to my crew: Eric,Buda Da Future, and Grants. We gotPapoose,Grafh, Smoke DZA, and more on there. Thatâ€™s just the beginning.
AllHipHop:So, is this just game music or something bigger?
Hip-Hop Gamer:Bigger. Iâ€™m making music for tech companies now, Xbox, Samsung. Weâ€™re creating full-on soundtracks for innovations. This is theHip-Hop-Tech-Culture collision.Itâ€™s the future. Youâ€™ll hear that beat when a device boots up and know itâ€™s Hip-Hop.
AllHipHop:Speaking of techâ€”AI, ChatGPT, all thatâ€”whatâ€™s your advice to the culture?
Hip-Hop Gamer:Master the tech. People arenâ€™t losing jobs to AI: theyâ€™re losing jobs because they donâ€™tunderstandthe tech. Learn it, control it, and thenbethe person companies need. If you fear it, youâ€™re already behind. If you learn it, you lead.
AllHipHop:Big facts. But I see you also walking around looking lean and mean. Whatâ€™s the secret, bro?
Hip-Hop Gamer:Fruits and vegetables!Discipline is key. Also, check out this app calledYuka. Scan food labels and it tells you whatâ€™s good or bad for your body. Like, those snack cakes? Zero out of 100. Donâ€™t do it to yourself.
AllHipHop:So youâ€™re blending health, tech, music, and gaming into one lifestyle.
Hip-Hop Gamer:Exactly.Prevention is better than the cure.I donâ€™t want people waking up one day hearing something scary from the doctor. Eat right, stay sharp, stay disciplinedâ€¦and youâ€™ll shine. Itâ€™s all connected.
AllHipHop:Man, thanks for dropping those gems.
Hip-Hop Gamer:AllHipHop forever. Letâ€™s game, letâ€™s build, letâ€™s win.

title: â€œSupermanâ€ 2025 Offers Light & Fantastical Take On Man of Steel
description:
Chris â€œBoogieâ€ Brown reviews the latest version of the DC classic superhero.

Superman, the first film under Warner Bros. Discoveryâ€™s new â€œDC Studiosâ€ banner, is directed by James Gunn and stars David Corenswet, Rachel Brosnahan and Nicholas Hoult. Here are my spoiler-free thoughts.
The film is set in a fictional universe, wheremetahumanshave been known to society for more than 300 years. Rather than functioning as an origin story, the narrative picks up with Superman already three years into his role as Earthâ€™s protector. The movie serves as a snapshot in time, depicting a chaotic week in the heroâ€™s life as he navigates the duality of his Smallville upbringing andKryptonianheritage.
Supermanâ€™s relationships, with Lois Lane, his dog Krypt and the public at-large, are explored under the cloud of backlash and scrutiny. A lot of this is orchestrated by the ever-manipulative Lex Luthor. Using social media smears and political influence, Luthor sets out to discredit the Man of Steel permanently. Heâ€™s aided byUltraman, a powerful foe, andThe Engineer, a nanotech-enhanced warrior.
In response, Superman forms an unlikely alliance with a group of metahumans including Mister Terrific, Hawkgirl, Guy Gardner and a mysterious otherworldly ally. Together, they aim to stop Luthorâ€™s sinister plans.
Going into the film with modest expectations, I was pleasantly surprised.Supermanis a solid and enjoyable superhero entry that delivers something new for fans of the character. That said, itâ€™s important to note this movie is tonally distinct from Zack Snyderâ€™s 2013 film,Man of Steel. WhileMan of Steelembraced a grounded and existential tone,Supermanveers sharply toward the fantastical. Itâ€™s closer to the spirit ofDCâ€™s Silver Age.
The tone is lighthearted, playful and even whimsical, with offbeat humor and vibrant visuals.Supermanaims to evoke the nostalgia of Richard Donnerâ€™s 1978 film while feeling like a live-action animated feature. Viewers familiar withSuperman: The Animated SeriesorMy Adventures with Supermanwill recognize the tone instantly. From the classic score to its bright color palette,Â this is classic material.
While the humor and sci-fi tropes donâ€™t always land, the film embraces its comic book roots unapologetically. Key action sequences involving Superman, Krypto and the Justice Gang offer fun, uneven spectacles.
The ensemble cast includes David Corenswet as Clark Kent/Superman, Rachel Brosnahan as Lois Lane and Nicholas Hoult as Lex Luthor. Ed Gathegi plays Mister Terrific and Nathan Fillion is Guy Gardner. Rounding out the cast is Isabela Merced as Hawkgirl, Anthony Carrigan as Metamorpho, Maria Gabriela de Faria as The Engineer and the legendaryWendell Pierceas Perry White. Last, but not least: Skyler Gisondo plays Jimmy Olsen.
Brosnahan delivers a confident, sharp portrayal of Lois Lane, capturing both her intelligence and spirit. Her chemistry with Corenswet feels genuine. Hoult plays a psychologically unstable, obsessive Lex Luthor with conviction. At times some of his manic moments slide into camp. Ed Gathegiâ€™s Mister Terrific is a standout, while performances by Fillion and Merced felt less memorable.
Corenswet shines in the dual role. He effectively capturingClark Kentâ€™s modest awkwardness and Supermanâ€™s earnest heroism. He looks the partâ€”standing at 6-foot-4â€”and brings warmth and physicality to the role, even if the suit design isnâ€™t ideal. His performance feels distinct among past portrayals, offering a fresh interpretation of the iconic character.
Still, the film isnâ€™t without its flaws. Tonally, it sometimes feels like aGuardians of the Galaxyfilm dressed in Supermanâ€™s colors. Gunn is well known for directing theGuardians of the Galaxytrilogy for Marvel. The crowded cast occasionally sidelines Superman himself. Visually, the film suffers from inconsistencies, with cinematographer Henry Brahamâ€™s ultra-wide lens choices leading to warped or uncanny character appearances in certain shots. Although itâ€™s an improvement over his work onThe Flash(2023), the over-lighting and visual distortions persist.
Despite those issues,Supermanmanages to balance its story, action, and joyful tone. There is one particularly violent scene involving Luthor, but this is mostly an accessible film that could appeal to all. Reception among hardcore comic book movie fans will likely vary depending on expectations.
If youâ€™re partial to the hopeful tone of 1978â€™sSuperman: The Movie, this may be your film. If you favor the brooding, philosophical depth ofMan of Steel, you might find this version lacking. However, if youâ€™re simply excited to see Superman back on the big screen,Supermandelivers a crowd-pleasing ride.
ThisSupermanfilm carves its own path with a fresh story, distinct tone and colorful direction. As the first entry in the new DC Universe, it packs a big punch.
Supermanopens in theaters nationwide on (Friday) July 11.
FINAL RATING:Â 3.5 out of 5 Stars
author: AllHipHop Staff

title: Trae Tha Truth Talks His Daughter Baby Truth, DJ Screw Legacy, Houstonâ€™s Cultural Power & More
description:
Houston Hip-Hop has always marched to the beat of its own slowed-down, candy-painted drum, andTrae Tha Truthis one of its most dedicated generals.

Trae is not only respected in the streets but also globally recognized for his humanity. Heâ€™s got those deep, organic ties toDJ Screwand theScrewed Up Click, but is also connected to his tireless community activism.
Now he blesses us with a new album,Â Angel, which dripped on his birthday, July 3. The H-Town veteran sat down withAllHipHopâ€˜sDJ Thorofor a heartfelt and candid conversation.
With his daughter Baby Truth by his side, Trae discusses the spiritual inspiration behind his new music. He also pays homage to DJ Screw, opens up about his humanitarian work across the U.S. and even imagines his dream collaborations.
This conversation peels back the layers of a man whoâ€™s as committed to his culture as he is to his calling.
AllHipHop:Â First off, I gotta say Iâ€™m a big fan. â€œSwangâ€ with Big Hawk is a classic.
Trae Tha Truth:Appreciate that. That record brought me to the national level. It defined Houston cultureâ€”cars, the sound, and Big Hawk, R.I.P.
AllHipHop:Â Letâ€™s talk about your new record â€œAll Right.â€
Trae:Yeah, it features my daughter Baby Truth andLeCrae. Itâ€™s all leading up to theAngelalbum.
AllHipHop:Â The track has gospel vibes. What inspired that direction?
Trae:Life. The struggles Iâ€™ve faced, especially with my daughter. When things get tough, I prayâ€”and God makes it all right. Thatâ€™s the message.
AllHipHop:Â What do you think about GloRilla winning a BET Award for Best Gospel Artist?
Trae:I donâ€™t usually comment on stuff that ainâ€™t my business. But if the song impacted people and God used her for that, who are we to judge? Thatâ€™s how powerful He is.
AllHipHop:Â Paul Wall told me Texas artists donâ€™t even have to leave the state to make a living.
Trae:Facts. We been had our own economy. You could go gold or platinum just in Texas. We created our own independent hustle.
AllHipHop:Â Thatâ€™s rare. In New York, nobody can do that.
Trae:Thatâ€™s why I ride so hard for Houston. From BeyoncÃ© and Yolanda Adams toTravis ScottandMegan Thee Stallion. We got legends in every lane.
AllHipHop:Â Do you think people mimic Houstonâ€™s sound?
Trae:Some do, but a lot pay homage. People donâ€™t realize Trap Soul stems from what DJ Screw did: slowing down R&B tracks and creating that vibe.
AllHipHop:Â So when did you first fall in love with Hip-Hop?
Trae:My pops was a big fan of gangster rap. Weâ€™d hitSoundwavesor Sam Goody every week for new tapes. My mom sang, so I had both R&B and rap in my blood.
AllHipHop:Â Your biggest market outside Houston?
Trae:New York. I could hold my own out there. Iâ€™ve got tracks with East Coast cats like Raekwon, Jadakiss, Ross, Jeezy. They respect the artistry.
AllHipHop:Â You ever intimidated working with any of your idols?
Trae:Never. Thatâ€™s like sparring. Iâ€™ve always been ready for the challenge: rapping, harmonizing, lyrical bars, whatever.
AllHipHop:Â If you could do a dream collab with any artist, dead or alive, who would it be?
Trae:DJ Screw. I gotta rep my culture. But if we talk powerhouse collabâ€”Michael Jackson, Pac, Nipsey, Big. Iâ€™d make a timeless classic with them.
AllHipHop:Â Speaking of Screw, what was your relationship like?
Trae:I met him at 15 or 16. By 19, I was on Screw tapes with my group Gorilla Mob. He gave us our first taste of radio. He wasnâ€™t just a DJ. He was my brother, my partner, my supporter. We were supposed to sign to his label before he passed. Iâ€™ll always carry his legacy.
AllHipHop:Â You do a lot for the community. Whatâ€™s new?
Trae:Iâ€™m always working. Just sent an 18-wheeler full of supplies to help tornado victims in St. Louis. I was helping with the LA fires too. Trade Day is coming up in Houstonâ€”July 17 through 21. But now I get calls to help nationwide.
AllHipHop:Â Houston gave you the key to the city, right?
Trae:Two keys, actually. I got awards, belt bucklesâ€¦stuff I didnâ€™t even know existed. Seven holidays in Houston and one in Milwaukee. But I feel like when I win, we all win. Itâ€™s not just me.
AllHipHop:Â What inspires your music now?
Trae:Life. Pain. Growth. I started rapping my brother Dinkyâ€™s lyrics when he was locked up. Now Iâ€™m decades deep and still here, still relevant.
AllHipHop:Â Letâ€™s talk cars. New York got BBS Boys, but yâ€™all got slabs.
Trae:Man, in Houston, if you ainâ€™t on slabs, you ainâ€™t made it. My brother used to gut the backseat and fill it with speakers, domes, and ride on them swingers. Itâ€™s a rite of passage.
AllHipHop:Â Your albumAngel. Tell me about it.
Trae:This oneâ€™s special. Itâ€™s my prized possession because of what I went through making it. Itâ€™s pain, itâ€™s God, itâ€™s soulful. One of the standout joints isâ€œAmenâ€ featuring Dave Chappelle.
AllHipHop:Â Thatâ€™s huge. Any hard copies or vinyl drops coming?
Trae:Not yet, but Cam Newton just told me I need to. I might drop some limited-edition colored vinyl. Itâ€™s time.
AllHipHop:You got anything on the film side?
Trae:Yeah, got a movie calledSoleon Tubi. Itâ€™s animated and features me. My daughterBaby Truthwants in on the next one, so we working on that too.
AllHipHop:Â Final sports question: how you feel about KD on the Rockets?
Trae:If they mesh right, it could work. Even before KD, our young squad had potential. But now, with KD, Jabari, VanVleet, and the restâ€”itâ€™s about roles and chemistry.
AllHipHop:Â Yo, appreciate you. Happy birthday and salute to Baby Truth.
Trae:Appreciate you, always love.
author: AllHipHop Staff

title: â€œSquid Gameâ€ Stars Jo Yu-riÂ & Yim Si-wan Talk Season 3, Hip-Hop Culture & More
description:
The global sensationSquid Gamereturns with Season 3â€”and joining the brutal competition are new standout cast membersJo Yu-ri(Player 222) andYim Si-wan(Player 333).

In an exclusive sit-down withAllHipHopâ€™s D-Nellz, the two stars open up about their emotional journeys, the toll of filming, and the pressure of joining the hit series.
Jo Yu-ri, known for her work as a singer, plays a pregnant participant fighting for survival.  Yim Si-wan, a former K-pop idol, brings complex layers to his morally shaky character. Both say the script pulled them in instantly. And, when they got comfortable, they were immersed fully in the story.
But this wasnâ€™t just about acting. SinceAllHipHopwas in the room, the conversation naturally shifted toHip-Hop. Korean rap has gained traction globally and both stars revealed their respect for the roots and the culture.
East met West in the most authentic wayâ€”and the synergy is undeniable.
AllHipHop (D-Nellz):When you first got the script for Season 3, what was your immediate reaction?
Yim Si-wan:I was completely hooked. I read the entire thing in one go. It was that immersiveâ€”I couldnâ€™t stop.
Jo Yu-ri:Same here. It took me about three hours, but I didnâ€™t put it down once. I had to know what happened.
AllHipHop:Did the global success ofSquid Gamebring added pressure to your performances?
Yim Si-wan:Definitely. At first, I felt that pressure. But once I read the script, it was so well-written that I just told myself: trust the story, trust the director, and trust my castmates. That helped me shift my focus.
Jo Yu-ri:I agree. The expectations were high, but I reminded myself to enjoy the process. Once we started filming, the pressure kind of melted away.
AllHipHop:What was the most challenging part of filming?
Yim Si-wan:Emotionally, it was tough. My characterâ€™s morality is murky. Heâ€™s not clearly a good or bad guy. That ambiguity took a mental toll while filming.
Jo Yu-ri:For me, it was also emotionally heavy. My character is pregnant, so beyond just surviving, sheâ€™s fighting to protect a child. That added a lot of emotional weight to every scene.
AllHipHop:Since weâ€™reAllHipHop, we have to askâ€¦how do you both feel about Hip-Hopâ€™s influence in Korean culture?
Yim Si-wan:I have huge respect for Hip-Hop. There are so many amazing artists I admire. Itâ€™s a genre that tells the truth in a raw, emotional way.
Jo Yu-ri:Iâ€™ve always felt a connection to Hip-Hopâ€”even if Iâ€™m more known for pop music. Itâ€™s powerful, and I think Korean and Western Hip-Hop are learning from each other every day.
Head towww.netflix.com/SquidGamefor all the action.

title: Squid Game Season 3: Cast & Director Share BTS Details, Insights In Exclusive Interview
description:
Squid Gametook the world by storm in 2021, becoming Netflixâ€™s most-watched series of all time with over 1.65 billion viewing hours in its first month. The Korean survival drama captivated audiences with its brutal social commentary, stunning visuals, and unforgettable characters. Now, after a global phenomenon and multiple Emmy wins,Squid Gamereturns with a highly anticipated third season.

AllHipHop caught up with actorLee Byung-hun, best known for his role as a masked enforcer in the series, directorHwang Dong-hyukand starLee Jung-jae(Player 456, Gi-hun). From slipping back into the signature red wig to the psychological depth of characters like Gi-hun and the mysterious Front Man, the team dives deep into whatâ€™s next.
With season three promising higher stakes, fans are eager to see how the story expands. The cast reveals how fanâ€™s energy helped shape the new season. InterviewerD-Nellzdigs deep to offer rare insight into the minds behind one of the most captivating shows of the decade.
AllHipHop:Itâ€™s an honor to speak with you all today. Letâ€™s keep things light and spoiler-free. First off, how did it feel to return to the world ofSquid Gameand begin filming again?
Lee Jung-jae (Actor):The first scene I filmed this season was with the red wig and I just couldnâ€™t believe I was wearing it again. I remember laughing a lot in the makeup trailer. It felt surreal. Of course, this all began with Director Hwangâ€™s vision, but I also think the energy and love from the fans played a huge part in bringing us back. Iâ€™m really grateful for that. So I put the wig on and gave it my all.
AllHipHop:As both actors and creators,Squid Gamereceived a massive wave of global attention. Did that impact your creative mindset or add pressure coming into Season 2?
Hwang Dong-hyuk (Director):Absolutely, there was pressure. The show became a global phenomenon, and expectations were incredibly high. But instead of letting that stress me out, I made a conscious effort to turn it into confidence. When we made Season 1, I was filled with doubtâ€”wondering if people would resonate with the story at all. But once I saw how much they embraced it, I realized they connected with the message I wanted to share. That gave me the confidence to tell Season 2 the way I truly wanted, believing that audiences would respond if I stayed authentic.
AllHipHop:Letâ€™s talk about two of the showâ€™s most complex characters, Gi-hun and the Front Man. Without spoiling anything, what should fans expect from their clash in Season 2?
Lee Byung-hun(The Front Man):Gi-hun and the Front Man actually followed very similar paths. Both were players in the game. Both witnessed betrayal, death, and were forced into situations where they had to take othersâ€™ lives. But whatâ€™s fascinating is that they ended up in completely opposite places. Gi-hun still believes in humanity and holds onto hope, while the Front Man has turned into a pessimist.
When they confront each other this season, youâ€™ll see that the Front Man still has a faint spark of humanity inside him. As I played him, I really tried to convey that internal struggle. Itâ€™s not spelled out directly in the script, but if you look closely, I think viewers will sense that even the Front Man might secretly hope Gi-hun is right.
AllHipHop:Thank you so much for your time. We canâ€™t wait to see how fans react to this new season.
Cast & Team:Thank you!
Check out Squid Game Season 3 on Netflix
